JWT.description:
HR-ON's API is secured with [OAuth 2.0](https://oauth.net/2/).
Any applications that wish to retrieve or update data using the API must first be authenticated and authorized to do so. 
We follow the [Authorization Framework](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749) protocol.
For documentation about the OAuth2 flows and refreshing tokens, see our [Auth Docs](https://auth.hr-on.com).

info.title: HR-ON API
info.description:
If you choose to use our API we provide a Postman collection link along with an API key, client id, and client secret to get you started immediately.
All you need to do is import the collection through File->Import->Link in Postman and enter the variables in the root of the collection.
The collection contains all endpoints found here, examples of retrieving and refreshing tokens, along with all endpoints found in https://auth.hr-on.com.
Additionally, the collection uses a pre-request script to automatically retrieve and refresh tokens for all calls when testing through Postman - 
allowing you to start testing without having to setup Authorization manually.

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

get.description: Fetches absences in your company. Use size and offset parameters to paginate through the results.

parameters.description: Specifies the amount of items to be returned. Defaults to 20.
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: Specifies the amount of items to skip before selection.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Specifies the ordering of items. Defaults to ASC (ascending).
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Specifies which attribute to order items by. Defaults to name.
parameters.name: orderBy

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://api.hr-on.com//v1/staff/absences?size=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&offset=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&order=SOME_STRING_VALUE&orderBy=SOME_STRING_VALUE' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.hr-on.com//v1/staff/absences?size=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&offset=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&order=SOME_STRING_VALUE&orderBy=SOME_STRING_VALUE",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("api.hr-on.com")

headers = { 'Authorization': "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN" }

conn.request("GET", "//v1/staff/absences?size=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&offset=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&order=SOME_STRING_VALUE&orderBy=SOME_STRING_VALUE", headers=headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.hr-on.com//v1/staff/absences?size=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&offset=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&order=SOME_STRING_VALUE&orderBy=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	req.Header.Add("Authorization", "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://api.hr-on.com//v1/staff/absences?size=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&offset=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE&order=SOME_STRING_VALUE&orderBy=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)
request["Authorization"] = 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

  --url https://api.hr-on.com//v1/staff/documentTemplates/%7Bid%7D \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"customId":"string","name":"string","description":"string","documentType":"string","language":"da_DK","dateFormat":"20-07-2021"}'

HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.patch("https://api.hr-on.com//v1/staff/documentTemplates/%7Bid%7D")
  .header("content-type", "application/json")
  .header("Authorization", "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN")
  .body("{\"customId\":\"string\",\"name\":\"string\",\"description\":\"string\",\"documentType\":\"string\",\"language\":\"da_DK\",\"dateFormat\":\"20-07-2021\"}")
  .asString();

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.hr-on.com//v1/staff/documentTemplates/%7Bid%7D",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "PATCH",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "{\"customId\":\"string\",\"name\":\"string\",\"description\":\"string\",\"documentType\":\"string\",\"language\":\"da_DK\",\"dateFormat\":\"20-07-2021\"}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN",
    "content-type: application/json"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("api.hr-on.com")

payload = "{\"customId\":\"string\",\"name\":\"string\",\"description\":\"string\",\"documentType\":\"string\",\"language\":\"da_DK\",\"dateFormat\":\"20-07-2021\"}"

headers = {
    'content-type': "application/json",
    'Authorization': "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN"
    }

conn.request("PATCH", "//v1/staff/documentTemplates/%7Bid%7D", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.hr-on.com//v1/staff/documentTemplates/%7Bid%7D"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"customId\":\"string\",\"name\":\"string\",\"description\":\"string\",\"documentType\":\"string\",\"language\":\"da_DK\",\"dateFormat\":\"20-07-2021\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("PATCH", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("Authorization", "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://api.hr-on.com//v1/staff/documentTemplates/%7Bid%7D")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Patch.new(url)
request["content-type"] = 'application/json'
request["Authorization"] = 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
request.body = "{\"customId\":\"string\",\"name\":\"string\",\"description\":\"string\",\"documentType\":\"string\",\"language\":\"da_DK\",\"dateFormat\":\"20-07-2021\"}"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

get.description: Fetches employees in your company. Use size and offset parameters to paginate through the results.

parameters.description: Specifies the amount of items to be returned. Defaults to 20.
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: Specifies the amount of items to skip before selection.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Specifies the ordering of items. Defaults to ASC (ascending).
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Specifies which attribute to order items by. Defaults to firstName.
parameters.name: orderBy

parameters.description: Enables filtering on the createdAt column. Expected format is ISO 8601.
parameters.name: createdAt

parameters.description: Enables filtering on the updatedAt column. Expected format is ISO 8601. Note that count is incorrect when using this filter.
parameters.name: updatedAt

parameters.description: Enables filtering on a system field. Use in conjunction with value.
parameters.name: systemField

parameters.description: Enables filtering on a custom field. Use in conjunction with value.
parameters.name: customFieldId

parameters.description: Enables filtering on a specific department.
parameters.name: departmentId

parameters.description: Enables filtering on a specific role.
parameters.name: roleId

parameters.description:
The value of the system field or custom field that should be filtered by.
Use in conjunction with systemField or customFieldId.
If the custom field value is from an option then the optionId should be provided as the value.
parameters.name: value

parameters.description: Sets which operator should be used for filtering. Defaults to 'equal'.
parameters.name: operator
